1.title: Amputees control bionic hand with thoughts, using wireless, electrodeless technology
1.description: 2022 - Economy, Healthy Life, Beauty, Family and Actual Articles
1.content: A medical breakthrough now allows amputees to control a bionic hand with their minds thanks to a unique myokinetic interface. The latter captures muscle movements via magnets implanted in the residual... [3423 symbols]
1.summary: A medical breakthrough allows amputees to control a bionic hand with their minds through a unique myokinetic interface, a system that captures muscle movements via magnets implanted in the residual muscles of the amputated arm and translates them into movements. The technology allows amputesurers to control the movements of their bionic limbs without wires, electrical connection, and allows them to perform everyday activities such as opening a jar, using a screwdriver, picking up a coin, and using a zipper. The BioRobotics Institute of the Scuola Superiore Sant’Anna in Pisacoordinated by Professor Christian Cipriani developed a new interface between the amputee’s residual arm and the robotic hand capable of decoding motor intentions. Unlike traditional systems using surface electrodes, this new technology involves magnets and muscles to control finger movements. It also allows for precise and intuitive control of gestures. The results of the experiment far exceeded expectations, with potential applications for other types of disabilities.

2.title: New poll says Trump has 15-point lead over Harris in Arkansas
2.description: In a new poll, former President Donald Trump has a 15-point lead in Arkansas over Vice President Kamala Harris.
2.content:
In a new poll, former President Donald Trump has a 15-point lead in Arkansas over Vice President Kamala Harris.

Example video title will go here for this video

Example video title will go here for t... [2185 symbols]
2.summary: A new poll by Talk Business & Politics and Hendrix College has found former President Donald Trump has a 15-point lead over Vice President Kamala Harris among likely Arkansas voters. The poll, conducted before the first and likely only debate between Trump and Harris, found that Trump leads by a 55-40% margin. This follows a trend of strong Republican performances in Arkansas, with both Republican and Democratic voters favoring their party's candidate nearly universally and independents favoring Trump by 8-percentage points. However, Dr. Jay Barth, a politics professor at Hendrix, suggested that Harris's improved performance could impact down ballot races.

3.title: Gulf of Mexico oil platforms being remanned with Hurricane Francine out of the way
3.description: About one-third of US Gulf platforms still evacuated, BSEE says
3.content:
Gulf of Mexico platforms being remanned with Hurricane Francine out of the way

About one-third of US Gulf platforms still evacuated, BSEE says

This GOES-16 GeoColor satellite image provided by the N... [352 symbols]
3.summary: Gulf of Mexico oil platforms are being remanned with Hurricane Francine out of the way, with about one-third of US Gulf platforms still evacuated due to the storm. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) has provided a satellite image showing Hurricane Francin approaching Louisiana on 11 September 2024. This comes as about one third of the US Gulf oil platforms evacuated. The BP has reported that about half of the remaining platforms are still being evacuated.

4.title: Jammu & Kashmir to set a record with 900+ candidates in the fray
4.description: Over 900 candidates are likely to be in the fray for the threephase J&K election, according to data so far. While vetting of 483 nominations for Phase 3 is underway, the total number of candidates is set to go higher than the 831 who contested Assembly polls in undivided J&K in 2014. Not only is the number of candidates on the uptick, there is also a clear increase in ground level footfall, number of public campaigns by political parties and the general electoral feel.
4.content:
(You can now subscribe to our 

 (You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channel

Over 900 candidates are likely to be in the fray for the threephase J&K election, according to data so f... [569 symbols]
4.summary: Over 900 candidates are expected to be in the fray for the upcoming Jammu & Kashmir election, a record set at least three times the previous year's total. While vetting of 483 nominations for Phase 3 is underway, the total number of candidates is expected to exceed the 831 who contested Assembly polls in undivided J&K in 2014. This increase in candidates and ground level footfall have also been noted, indicating an increase in public campaigns by political parties and electoral activity.

5.title: Annual event helps local veterans connect with community resources
5.description: An annual event downtown is helping local veterans become better connected with community resources.
5.content:
Rochester, N.Y. - An annual event downtown is helping local veterans become better connected with community resources.

The Veterans Outreach Center hosted its "2024 Stand Down and Job Fair" event at ... [900 symbols]
5.summary: The Veterans Outreach Center in Rochester, New York, hosted its annual "2024 Stand Down and Job Fair" event at the Rochester Public Market on Friday. The event aims to connect local veterans with community resources such as healthcare providers and job opportunities. The 23rd annual event also featured free lunches and giveaways. Laura Heltz, the executive director at Veterans Out Reach Center, expects around 500 veterans to attend the event to find out what they qualify for and what resources are available for them in the community.

6.title: Alfred Scorches Past Richardson To Diamond League 100m Finals Win
6.description: Olympic champion Julien Alfred scorched to victory in the 100m at the Diamond League finals in Brussels on Friday as US rival Sha'Carri Richardson finished well down the field.
6.content:
Olympic champion Julien Alfred scorched to victory in the 100m at the Diamond League finals in Brussels on Friday as US rival Sha'Carri Richardson finished well down the field.

It had been Richardson... [662 symbols]
6.summary: Olympic champion Julien Alfred won the 100m at the Diamond League finals in Brussels, beating US rival Sha'Carri Richardson in 10.88 seconds. Despite Richardson having previously beaten Alfred in Zurich, Alfred won at the King Baudouin Stadium. Britain's Dina Asher-Smith and Ivorian Marie-Josee Ta Lou-Smith came second and third respectively. Richardson finished eighth in the nine-woman field in 11.23 seconds.

7.title: While FromSoftware Fans Are Stuck in the Fog for Their Long-Awaited Bloodborne Update, One Ubisoft Title From 2015 Now Leaps to 60FPS Glory
7.description: From Stuck in the Past to a 60FPS Future, it's time for Assassin's Creed Syndicate to complete its redemption arc within the game's community.
7.content: Bloodborne remains one of the few games on PlayStation’s catalog that stays frustratingly locked at 30FPS on Sony’s current-gen hardware, despite persistent demands for an update and the collective ho... [3743 symbols]
7.summary: While FromSoftware is receiving a long awaited update for their long-awaited version of FromSoftware's Bloodborne, another Ubisoft title from 2015, Assassin’s Creed Syndicate, is set to receive a 60FPS update. This follows a period where the game remained locked at 30FPS on Sony's current-gen hardware, despite fans' persistent demand for an update. Despite this, this news comes as a bitter reminder of Bloodborne's limitation on Sony’�s current-generation hardware, especially considering that both games were released in the same year. The game's combat is considered one of the most distinctive in the series and offers a chance to revisit the game in its enhanced form. However, Sony's ignorance over the delay in Bloodborne is seen as baffling as community members have demonstrated how easy to break the tie between animations, buffs/debuffs, and frame rate.

8.title: Sushma Group Buys 59-Acre Land for Mix-Use Project In Ludhiana
8.description: Sushma Group Buys 59-Acre Land for Mix-Use Project In Ludhiana
8.content: Sushma Group has acquired a 59-acre land parcel in a prime location. The strategic acquisition will see the development of a mixed-use project, comprising residential, industrial, and commercial plots... [2655 symbols]
8.summary: Sushma Group has acquired a 59-acre land parcel in Ludhiana, India, for a mixed-use project aimed at enhancing Ludhianian's real estate landscape. The project will include residential, industrial, and commercial plots. The acquisition is part of Sushma's long-term vision to contribute to the strategic growth of Ludhana. The mixed-used project is expected to create a ripple effect in the real estate sector, focusing on sustainable development and modern urban planning. The industrial segment will offer fast connectivity to Ludhiani Airport and provide essential services such as on-site medical facilities, underground cabling, emergency firefighting systems, electric charging stations, and solar-powered common areas. The land acquisition is anticipated to pave the way for transformative developments that further position Ludhrian as a key player in the region's economic future.

9.title: This Low Volatility High Return Investment Loves the Fed's Outlook for Rates
9.content:
Thursday’s Producer Price Index report all but guaranteed that the Fed will cut interest rates by 0.25% this upcoming Wednesday.

There are a number of investments that are set to benefit more than ot... [4333 symbols]
9.summary: The Federal Reserve (Fed) is expected to cut interest rates by 0.25% this week, potentially marking the first reduction since raising rates in response to inflation. This comes as investors are preparing for the Fed's first interest rate cut. The SPDR S&P Insurance ETF (KIE) has already posted returns of 21%, 50% better than the Nasdaq 100. The lower interest rate environment is likely to shift the headwind that insurance companies have faced due to higher interest rates, helping to inflate the value of their portfolios. This could result in an increase in revenue and profits for insurance companies, a significant increase since the Housing Crisis of 2009.

10.title: Iraqi and US forces kill a top IS commander and other militants in joint operation
10.description: BAGHDAD (AP) — Iraqi forces and American troops have killed a senior commander with the Islamic State group who was wanted by the United States, as well as several other prominent militants, Iraq's military said on Friday.The operation in Iraq's west
10.content:
Iraqi and US forces kill a top IS commander and other militants in joint operation

BAGHDAD (AP) — Iraqi forces and American troops have killed a senior commander with the Islamic State group who was ... [3349 symbols]
10.summary: Iraq and US forces have killed a senior commander with the Islamic State group (IS), Abu Ali Al-Tunisi, and several other militants in a joint operation in Iraq's western Anbar province. The operation, which began in late August, also included members of the Iraqi National Intelligence Service and Iraq’s air force. Among the dead was IS commander from Tunisia, Ahmad Hamed Zwein, the IS deputy commander in Iraq. The Iraqi military also confiscated weapons and computers, smart phones and 10 explosive belts. Despite their defeat in Iraq and Syria, IS sleeper cells have been on the rise, killing and wounding scores of people.

1.1.title: Ernst Says Mexico Needs To Step Up And Secure Release Of Kidnapped Iowa Woman - KIWA Radio
1.1.description: Washington, DC — Iowa Senator Joni Ernst says she’s pressing Mexican authorities to secure the safe return of a 51-year-old Des Moines woman who was kidnapped in northern Mexico a […]
1.1.content:
Washington, DC — Iowa Senator Joni Ernst says she’s pressing Mexican authorities to secure the safe return of a 51-year-old Des Moines woman who was kidnapped in northern Mexico a month ago.

Chris Le... [877 symbols]
1.1.summary: Iowa Senator Joni Ernst is urging Mexican authorities to secure the safe return of 51-year-old Des Moines woman, Chris Leguisano, who was kidnapped in northern Mexico over a month ago. Legusano was last seen in Reynosa, Mexico, less than an hour from the U-S southern border. This is the second high-profile assault of American citizens in that part of Mexico in the past two years. The State Department has briefed Ernst's staff on outreach to Mexican authorities and how US law enforcement are involved in the case.

2.1.title: Doctor warns he is helpless to care for patients in new Amendment 4 ad
2.1.description: The new ad is part of a campaign to build support.
2.1.content: The political committee behind Amendment 4 has launched a second commercial featuring a doctor voicing his concerns about Florida’s six-week abortion ban and his helplessness to assist pregnant women.... [2436 symbols]
2.1.summary: The political committee behind Amendment 4 has released a second commercial featuring a doctor expressing his concerns about Florida's six-week abortion ban and his helplessness to assist pregnant women. The commercial, part of Floridians Protecting Freedom's multimillion-dollar ad campaign to support the abortion rights initiative, was released Friday. The group declined to disclose how much it is spending on the ads, with the Nov. 5 election less than two months away. The Amendment 4 ballot question states that no law shall prohibit, penalize, delay, or restrict abortion before viability or when necessary to protect the patient’s health.

4.1.title: Ezra Klein Makes the Conservative Case for Border Control to Sec. Mayorkas
4.1.description: Ezra Klein Makes the Conservative Case for Border Control to Sec. Mayorkas
4.1.content: Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas visited Ezra Klein's podcast this week and the results are pretty interesting. What's immediately apparent in this discussion is that progressive comment... [7100 symbols]
4.1.summary: Progressive commentator Ezra Klein has made the Conservative Case for Border Control on his podcast, where Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas was asked about the impact of the Biden administration's actions on the border. Klein, however, seemed slow-walking the interview, giving Mayorka an extended opportunity to deny the obvious. He highlighted the issue of communication and the broken asylum system, which he found to be a major factor in the surge, and suggested that the administration's botched communications played a significant role in this issue. Mayorksas denied these claims, stating that he does not believe that rhetoric was the draw to people and does not blame Joe Biden for this. The situation at the border, which Biden and his advisers refuse to call a crisis, is the result of an administration that was forewarned of the expected surge and lacks preparation to deal with it.

5.1.title: UAPB's M4 Band Secures Spot in Honda Battle of the Bands 2025 by Fan Vote
5.1.description: By fan vote, the University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff (UAPB) Marching Musical Machine of the Mid-South (M4) secured a spot in the 2025 Honda Battle of the Bands.  Thanks to our fans, M4 will represent Arkansas in this historic event in SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, CA on Sat. Feb. 1, 2025, as Honda brings the tradition and culture of HBCU schools to the West Coast for the first time.  Check out the THV11 coverage of when the band learned about the invite. Be sure to post a thumbs up and  #UAPBM4Band.
5.1.content: By fan vote, the University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff (UAPB) Marching Musical Machine of the Mid-South (M4) secured a spot in the 2025 Honda Battle of the Bands. Thanks to our fans, M4 will represent ... [2948 symbols]
5.1.summary: The University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff (UAPB) Marching Musical Machine of the Mid-South (M4) secured a spot in the 2025 Honda Battle of the Bands. The event, held at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, will be Honda's first time as Honda brings the tradition and culture of HBCU schools to the West Coast. The M4 Band, known for its high-energy performances and innovative musical arrangements, has a history of representing UAPB and Arkansas on national stages. Honda announced North Carolina A&T University and Southern University in July 2024 as the first two participating bands for the 2025 Lineup. All bands participating in the voting process will be awarded an HBOB Legacy Grant from Honda. Tickets for the HBOB 2025 are on sale now at http://www.hondabattleofthebands.com.

6.1.title: Trump's ties to Laura Loomer could blow his run for president
6.1.description: Now, nearly 50 days from the 2024 presidential election, there are signs that Trump's presidential campaign is reeling and even at war - with itself.
6.1.content:
Now, nearly 50 days from the 2024 presidential election, there are signs that Trump’s presidential campaign is reeling and even at war – with itself.

Multiple sources familiar with the campaign struc... [6668 symbols]
6.1.summary: The Trump presidential campaign is reportedly at odds nearly 50 days from the 2024 presidential election, with multiple sources suggesting that the two campaign co-managers, Susie Wiles and Chris LaCivita, may not be able to keep their jobs due to their poor performance in the ABC News debate and the decision to allow Laura Loomer, a 9/11 conspiracy theorist, to accompany former president to memorial events. The campaign has been criticized by supporters and allies, including Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor-Greene and Sen. Lindsey Graham, who have denounced Loomher's relationship with Trump. The Trump campaign has not commented on why Loomi was allowed to fly with the president, but a campaign source distanced themselves from her. Wiles, a registered lobbyist with major public affairs firm Mercury, may have motivations for her involvement in the campaign, including winning the election November 2023.

9.1.title: Capito Announces Fall 2024 Academy Days
9.1.description: CHARLESTON, W.Va. – Today, U.S. Senator Shelley Moore Capito (R-W.Va.) announced she will host four...
9.1.content: CHARLESTON, W.Va. – Today, U.S. Senator Shelley Moore Capito (R-W.Va.) announced she will host four Academy Days this month for West Virginia students interested in learning more about opportunities a... [1509 symbols]
9.1.summary: U.S. Senator Shelley Moore Capito (R-W.Va.) has announced that she will host four Academy Days in fall 2024 for West Virginia students to learn about opportunities at the U.S.'s service academies and available Reserve Officers’ Training Corps (ROTC) scholarships. The events will be open to students interested in attending the academies or receiving an ROTC scholarship. Representatives from the service academy admissions representatives and local ROT C scholarship program representatives will be available to answer questions about these opportunities. An appointment to a service academy is a fully funded education opportunity valued from $240,000 to over $400,000.

10.1.title: University lobbyists are failing young adults
10.1.description: To improve finances for postsecondary students, advocacy groups such as Universities Canada and U15 must make bolder requests of the federal budget
10.1.content: Dr. Paul Kershaw is a policy professor at the University of British Columbia and founder of Generation Squeeze, Canada’s leading voice for generational fairness. He offers policy advice to governments... [4714 symbols]
10.1.summary: Dr. Paul Kershaw, a policy professor at the University of British Columbia and founder of Generation Squeeze, has criticised the university sector for failing to adequately advocate for the financial impact of postsecondary students. He suggests that advocacy groups such as Universities Canada and U15, representing Canada's top research universities, should make bolder requests from the federal budget, as should individual universities of their provincial governments. The latest budget submission from Universities Canada did not contain a specific funding request for the sector. This is a mistake, as it does not compare the small size of university advocates' financial requests to new investments in other programs. Additionally, he argues that more ambitious advocacy from the postsecondary sector should start now as Ottawa reduces the number of international students recruited to pay high tuition to cover revenue shortfalls. He also notes that provincial governments are also implicated in failing to fund postsecondary education.
